gardenbot.title: Building a Smart Garden with ESP32
gardenbot.intro: How I automated my garden watering system using ESP32, moisture sensors, and a mobile app for remote monitoring and control.
gardenbot.author: Johan Johansson

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: In this article, I'll walk you through building an automated garden monitoring and watering system using an ESP32 microcontroller, soil moisture sensors, and a mobile application for remote control.

hardware.title: Hardware Components
hardware.content: The system uses ESP32 for its built-in WiFi capabilities, DHT22 sensors for temperature and humidity, capacitive soil moisture sensors, and a relay module to control water pumps. The entire setup is powered by a 5V supply with backup battery support.

software.title: Software Architecture
software.content: The mobile app communicates with the ESP32 via MQTT protocol, allowing real-time monitoring of sensor data and remote control of watering schedules. The system includes automatic watering based on soil moisture thresholds and weather forecasts.

future.title: Future Improvements
future.content: Future enhancements include solar panel integration, machine learning for optimal watering schedules, and support for multiple garden zones with individual moisture monitoring.

chatconnect.title: Building ChatConnect: Real-Time Messaging with E2E Encryption
chatconnect.intro: A deep dive into creating a secure real-time chat application with end-to-end encryption, WebRTC video calls, and WebSocket messaging.
chatconnect.author: Johan Johansson

overview.title: Overview
overview.content: Building a secure, real-time chat application requires careful consideration of security, scalability, and user experience. This project implements end-to-end encryption, WebRTC for peer-to-peer video calls, and WebSocket for instant messaging.

security.title: Security Implementation
security.content: The application uses Signal Protocol for end-to-end encryption, ensuring that only the sender and recipient can read messages. Private keys never leave the device, and the server only routes encrypted data without access to message content.

realtime.title: Real-Time Communication
realtime.content: WebSocket connections maintain persistent connections for instant message delivery. Redis pub/sub handles message distribution across multiple server instances, ensuring scalability and reliability.

webrtc.title: Video Calling with WebRTC
webrtc.content: WebRTC enables direct peer-to-peer video calls without routing through the server, reducing latency and server load. The application includes STUN/TURN servers for NAT traversal and connection reliability.

lessons.title: Lessons Learned
lessons.content: The biggest challenges were handling connection failures gracefully and optimizing for mobile networks with varying bandwidth. Implementing message queuing and retry logic was essential for a smooth user experience.

smarthome.title: SmartHome Dashboard: Unified IoT Control
smarthome.intro: Creating a unified dashboard for managing smart home devices from different manufacturers using MQTT, React, and Node.js.
smarthome.author: Johan Johansson

goals.title: Project Goals
goals.content: The goal was to create a unified dashboard for managing all smart home devices from different manufacturers, avoiding the fragmentation of having multiple apps for lights, thermostats, and security cameras.

stack.title: Technology Stack
stack.content: The dashboard is built with React for the frontend and Node.js for the backend. MQTT broker handles communication with IoT devices, while a PostgreSQL database stores device states, automation rules, and historical data.

integration.title: Device Integration
integration.content: The system supports multiple protocols including MQTT, Zigbee, and HTTP APIs. Custom adapters translate device-specific commands into a unified interface, making it easy to add support for new devices.

automation.title: Automation Rules
automation.content: Users can create custom automation rules using a visual flow editor. Rules can be time-based, triggered by sensor readings, or activated by device state changes. Complex scenarios like 'turn off all lights when leaving home' are easy to configure.

energy.title: Energy Monitoring
energy.content: The dashboard includes real-time energy consumption tracking and historical analytics. Users can identify power-hungry devices and optimize their usage patterns to reduce electricity bills.

next.title: Next Steps
next.content: Future development includes voice control integration, machine learning for predictive automation, and enhanced security features like anomaly detection for unusual device behavior.

budgettracker.title: BudgetTracker: Personal Finance Management
budgettracker.intro: Building a comprehensive personal finance tool with expense tracking, budget planning, and insightful data visualizations.
budgettracker.author: Johan Johansson

why.title: Why I Built BudgetTracker
why.content: Managing personal finances can be overwhelming with multiple accounts, subscriptions, and daily expenses. I built BudgetTracker to simplify expense tracking and provide actionable insights into spending patterns.

features.title: Core Features
features.content: The application includes automatic expense categorization, recurring transaction detection, budget alerts, and customizable spending limits. Users can create multiple budgets for different categories like groceries, entertainment, and transportation.

architecture.title: Technical Architecture
architecture.content: Built with Angular for the frontend and Node.js/Express backend, BudgetTracker uses MySQL for relational data storage. The architecture supports real-time updates and synchronization across multiple devices.

visualization.title: Data Visualization
visualization.content: Interactive charts built with Chart.js help users understand their spending habits. Monthly comparisons, category breakdowns, and trend analysis make it easy to identify areas for improvement.

security.title: Security and Privacy
security.content: All financial data is encrypted at rest and in transit. The application follows security best practices including password hashing with bcrypt, JWT authentication, and secure session management.

future.title: Future Enhancements
future.content: Planned features include bank account integration via Plaid API, automated savings recommendations using machine learning, and collaborative budgets for families or roommates.
